context/8: With evidence, that you may qualify as "refutable" in the year 1912, one of the members of the opposite party that for a strange coincidence, has the same name that the man refered to in this same debate, in his role as Minister ordered the closing of the newspapers "Free Court" and "Opposition" preventing the annunciation of a fraudulent business.

context: Just long enough to admit that the South has counter-attacked in force and... we've lost this engagement.
response: Also the numerous reports I've received prove that the wrong man has been on trial here.
context/2: Sergeant Lebbard, have the bugler sound assembly.
context/3: The good Lord let me know if something worth fighting for, a body better fight.
context/5: Mr. Colonel... if there's any driving to do, we'll do it.
context/6: You women clear out of here before I have you driven out.
context/7: Look, men, I appreciate what you're trying to do for me, but you're gonna get me hung.
context/9: Now that we've been introduced, let's get out of here.

context/0: Better than any three men, Lieutenant, any three men.
context/1: I'll take my gun back if you don't mind.
context/2: If I remember correctly, you don't need much practice.
context/3: You won't hit anything, but you'll sure as blazes scare them to death.
context/5: That's fine, Hetty.
context/6: Get your head down so you can see that front sight.

context/2: I think I'd better call them.
context/5: Charlie, you hear that?
context/6: You have just listening to General Montgomery Smith.
context/9: Four companies of state militia are proceeding from Trenton to Grovers Mill and will aid in the evacuation of homes within the range of military operations.

context: You mean, you deliberately aimed at Mrs. Granger and Lutts got in the way?
context/0: She was supposed to be the one.
context/2: It was an accident.
context/5: No, no.
context/6: then you murdered George Lutts.
context/7: If you are not trying to protect someone,
context/8: You took a shooting stand apart, destroying evidence.
context/9: You knew Mrs. Granger was going to be on that hilltop.

context: Now, you say the murderer is always caught because all the ones we know of have been caught.
context/0: Now, there must be many others who have never been discovered.
context/1: Well, those people killed and were discovered only years afterwards by accident or belated confession.
context/2: Aye, I have.

context/6: Now that's the thing.
